messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A coincidence is when two things happen at the same time by chance. A prophecy is when someone says what will happen in the future. Sometimes you dream about a phone call from an old friend. Or you dream that someone close to you dies. This is more likely a coincidence than a prophecy. And, of course, we probably forget all the times we dream about these things but they do not happen.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The final sentence 'And, of course, we probably forget all the times we dream about these things but they do not happen' is structurally too complex for A2. It contains multiple clauses. Factual inaccuracy detected: The original text states 'we probably choose to forget,' which is not the same as 'we probably forget.' Your version removes the concept of choice, altering the original meaning. Defining the keywords was the correct procedure, but it does not excuse these fundamental errors.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: A coincidence is when two things happen at the same time by chance. A prophecy is when someone says what will happen in the future. Sometimes you dream about a phone call from an old friend. Or you dream that someone close to you dies. This is probably a coincidence, not a prophecy. We dream about these things many times, but they do not happen. We probably choose to forget those dreams.

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a perfect example of A2 simplification. It correctly defines the necessary keywords ('coincidence', 'prophecy') at the beginning. All sentences are simple, declarative, and use high-frequency A2 vocabulary. The output is factually identical to the original text. No violations were found.
